message.content:
1. Breakfast: Overnight Chia Pudding with Fresh Berries
Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup chia seeds
- 1 cup unsweetened almond milk (or any other non-dairy milk)
- 1 tsp pure vanilla extract
- 1 tbsp maple syrup or agave nectar (if desired)
- 1 cup mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, blackberries)
- Optional: toppings like shredded coconut, sliced kiwi, or diced mango

Instructions:
1. In a jar or bowl, combine chia seeds, almond milk, vanilla extract, and maple syrup (if using). Mix well and cover. Refrigerate overnight or for at least 4 hours until the pudding has set.
2. In the morning, top with mixed berries and any additional toppings of your choice. Enjoy!

2. Lunch: Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables & Lemon-Tahini Dressing
Ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked quinoa (prepared according to package instructions)
- 1 medium zucchini, sliced
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced
- 1 cup canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- Lemon-Tahini Dressing:
  - 3 tbsp tahini
  - Juice of 1 lemon
  - 1/2 tsp ground cumin
  - 1 garlic clove (omit if you can't have garlic)
  - Salt and pepper, to taste
  - 2-4 tbsp water, as needed for desired consistency

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Toss zucchini with a little olive oil, salt, and pepper, then spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes until tender.
2. In a large bowl, combine quinoa, roasted zucchini, cherry tomatoes, red onion, chickpeas, and parsley.
3. For the dressing, whisk together tahini, lemon juice, cumin, and salt in a small bowl. If needed, add water to achieve your desired consistency. Pour over salad and toss well to combine. Enjoy!

3. Dinner: Baked Lemon Herb Salmon with Steamed Green Beans & Brown Rice
Ingredients:
- 1 lb salmon fillet (skin on)
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1 tsp dried dill or Italian seasoning
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup brown rice, uncooked
- 1 lb fresh green beans, trimmed

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with foil or parchment paper. Place salmon on the prepared baking sheet and brush with olive oil. Squeeze lemon juice over the fillet, then season with dill or Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until cooked through.
2. Meanwhile, cook brown rice according to package instructions.
3. In a steamer basket over boiling water, steam green beans for 4-6 minutes until tender but still crisp. Season with salt and pepper.
4. Serve the baked salmon alongside steamed green beans and brown rice. Enjoy your nutritious and delicious meal!
